data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
MAP goal: 65 mmHg or greater, SpO2 goal: greater than 92%
If/when temperature greater than 38.5 DegC and not completed in past 24 hours, then RN to order Blood Cultures x2, Sputum C&S, Urinalysis Macroscopic (with dipstick)
Continuous, remains on at all times
q4h, if patient expresses pain, use Numeric Rating Scale (goal less than 4). If patient exhibits signs of pain, use Behavioural Pain Scale (goal less than 6)
Insert 2 large bore IV's unless already in place
Contraindications to nasal insertion include facial, basal skull, or neck trauma. Order X-ray post tube placement to confirm position, if required
Tube for feeding, insert large bore. Check gastric residual volume q4h
Tube to Clamped, insert large bore. Check gastric residual volume q4h
Insert small bore  (not indicated if gastric suction and/or decompression required)
No suction, Tube for feeding, Check gastric residual volume q4h
Clamped, Check gastric residual volume q4h
Indwelling, Daily assessment for need of catheter
30 degrees or greater, if no thoracic / lumbar spine precautions
Cervical Spine Precautions, Brace and Activity Orders (Module)
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Refer to your organization’s enteral nutritional guidelines and policies

Prescribe and administer ICU Electrolyte Replacement Module within HAU only when the following two criteria are met: serum creatinine is less than 150 micromol/L and a result of normal renal function, and urine output is greater than 0.5 mL/kg/hour x 2 consecutive hours
